article.name: Clone a Phishing or Training Campaign
article.title: Clone a Phishing or Training Campaign
article.body:
Note:We’ve added advanced features to phishing templates! All accounts will be opted in to phishing template advanced features in 2025. For more information, see our Phishing Templates Advanced Features Guide.

You can create a clone of any phishing or training campaign as a starting point for setting up a new test.

The clone will contain all of the same settings, with the exception of the Start Date and End Date (if applicable) which you will have to set manually.

How to Clone a Phishing Campaign

In order to clone a phishing campaign, follow the steps below:

  1. From your KSAT account, navigate to Phishing > Campaigns.
  2. Click the Actions drop-down menu to the right of the campaign you'd like to copy.
  3. Click Clone.
  4. The Clone Phishing Campaign page will open, will allow you to set up your cloned campaign.

How to Clone a Training Campaign

In order to clone a training campaign, follow the steps below:

  1. From your KSAT account, navigate to Training > Campaigns.
  2. Click the Actions drop-down menu to the right of the campaign you'd like to copy.
  3. Click Clone.
  4. The Clone Training Campaign page will open, which will allow you to set up your cloned campaign.

images.alt:
This image displays a segment of a web application interface featuring a data table used for managing security campaigns or phishing tests.

**Table Structure:**
The table headers define nine columns: **Name**, **Groups**, **Tests**, **Phish-prone %**, **Last Test**, **Next Test**, **Status**, **Duration**, and **Actions**.

**Data Content Examples:**
*   Campaign entries include details such as "CEO Fraud Test" (One-time from categories: IT, My CEO Fraud) and "Current Events and Social Networking" (Monthly from topics: Current Events, Social Networking).
*   Metrics include groups (e.g., "All Users"), number of tests (e.g., 1 or 6), and phish-prone percentages (e.g., 9.1% or 0.0%).
*   Date fields specify test schedules, such as "Last Test" (07/16/2025, 3:37 AM) and "Next Test" (11/05/2025, 2:37 AM).
*   The **Status** column uses a dark gray pill label, showing "closed."
*   The **Duration** column includes text (e.g., "Tracking 1 Day") and a visual blue progress bar.

**Action Menu Focus:**
An interactive dropdown menu, activated from the action icon (vertical ellipsis/bars) in the 'Actions' column, is displayed for the campaign named "Current Events and Social Networking." The menu presents five distinct options, each paired with a corresponding icon:

1.  Edit (Pencil Icon)
2.  **Clone** (Stacked Square Icon) - *Highlighted by a red circular emphasis.*
3.  Deactivate (Toggle Switch Icon)
4.  Hide from Reports (Document Icon)
5.  Delete (Trash Bin Icon)
images.context: rong> page will open, will allow you to set up your cloned campaign.

images.alt:
The image displays a data grid used for managing learning or security initiatives. The grid columns include **Name**, **Groups** (showing "All Users"), **Content**, **Total Duration**, **% Complete**, and **Actions**.

**Contextual Data:**
Three rows are visible, all marked with an "In Progress" badge. The second row, titled "Security Awareness Initiative," which has a "78% Complete" status (16 minutes duration), is the active element.

**UI Interaction Focus:**
The contextual action menu (vertical ellipsis icon) for the "Security Awareness Initiative" is open, displaying a dropdown list of available administrative commands.

**Menu Elements:**
The menu lists five options:
1.  **Edit** (Pencil icon)
2.  **Clone** (Stacked squares icon)
3.  **Close** (X icon)
4.  **Delete** (Trash can icon)
5.  **Enroll Users** (Person icon with plus sign)

The **Clone** option is specifically highlighted by a red circular annotation, indicating the targeted action or instructional focus.
